result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Marie Gibas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence with 170 days credit.
Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of 2 years to commence after the period of revocation has been served.
Court order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan.

-  Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $600  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.
Court advises the defendant she cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised she cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; with 170 days credit.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count  1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5  years and 4 months, concurrent to any other sentence with  170  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  2 years and 4 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   3 years.  

As to Count  2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  3  years and 6 months, concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; with  170  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 year and 6 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -   2 years.  

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $600  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  Court ordered Alcohol Assessment.  Court order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.
-  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for  2 years.   
-  Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device for a period of  2  years to commence after the period of revocation has been served.
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kayla Marie Gibas.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to Counts 1 and 2:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  as to both counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  3    DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant she cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised she cannot vote until her civil rights are restored.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Kayla Marie Gibas.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defendant has a pending felony before Judge John Franke. Branch 40 authorizes transfer for possible global resolution.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing before Judge Franke.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Received and Filed:  Defendant's Sentencing Letter.

Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Sentencing Document.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Kayla Marie Gibas not in court, in custody at the House of Correction.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant has a pending felony before Branch 17, Judge Stark.  Branch 40 authorizes/accepts transfer for possible global resolution.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer M.Musa.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Kayla M. Gibas - #2022005196, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in trial this week.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kayla Marie Gibas in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kayla Marie Gibas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
